beans.description:
This adaptor does the following...
* reads data from stdin * converts it into an ordered map * writes the data via an insert statement
It is designed to illustrate the basic structure of an adaptor that writes to a database.
Run it like this...
java org.openadaptor.spring.SpringAdaptor -config map-table-writer.xml -props db.props
You must supply db.props populated appropriately for your environment.
You need the following in your classpath
lib lib/openadaptor.jar lib/openadaptor-spring.jar lib/openadaptor-depends.jar <database jar>

bean.description: This creates the simple router: Reader -> MapConverter -> ScriptProcessor -> Writer.
Converts input into an ordered map with two fields.
This will just change the id field from a String (as parsed) into an int. Default dataBinding to record is 'oa_data'.

property.name: script
property.value: id=parseInt(id);//This will make it an int :-) oa_data.put('detail',null); //Just to test writing null field
